column4: I have no video overlay on radeon OS drivers: http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/34582/
help please
Did you see the new forum posts?
not recently but i checked before with no result. did you see anything about it there?
Yes, todays lists the fix for most all ATI,nVidea , http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=204910
i use open source drivers, so it doesnt apply
They are propietary, but they are at least working with Open Source.
No i use the open source 'ati' or 'radeon' driver, supported by the community. not the proprietary written by ati
I cannot , or do not have the Linux know how to get mine working, I am stuck with 800x600 reso , its kinda frustrateing. But its a learning experiance, so its fun.
mine is working just fine except for the video overlay. i have an r200 (8500) chip
Would you or may I ask you to assist me in getting my Xpress 200 series to function? This #channel is obviously not the place, but I am linuxly challenged. :-$
so you want to run the proprietary drivers? Did you follow the instructions on th ubuntu site?
Not yet, I am slow, I looked at them all and bkmarked, but have yet to do any installs as it looks quite complicated.
This one seems to be the one you should start with: https://help.ubuntu.com/community/BinaryDriverHowto/ATI. I think you should manage. Just follow the instructions. Its like making a cake.
Thank you kindly
if it wont help you could change the /etc/X11/xorg.conf so that in Section "Screen", subsection "Display" all Modes start with your desired resolution
you should know what im talking about when you open and look at the file
This new page on the forums says that the fix is to not use fglrx, the Binary Pages says use fglrx, hrmm, I will try it again, Thank you.
YAY! worked like a CHARM! Thank you Thank you! :)
Happy to have helped you
My error was not doing the Ctrl-Alt-Bckspace to save and reconfig.
heh, the most annoying errors are the ones needing simplest solutions. It can be dissapointing to find out about a simple fix after hours of annoyance.
